intro: Neobesseya odorata, commonly known as the sweet-scented bottle tree, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its distinctive bottle-shaped trunk and clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. Neobesseya odorata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and pleasant aroma. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
